{"bundles":[{"versions":[{"version":"0.7.0","id":"44943ea6-d9ac-43ae-bebd-49f27ea47380"}],"updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:33Z","relay_groups":[],"name":"operable","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:33Z","id":"57f815c5-c986-4b93-8435-9b5b8056ddcb","enabled_version":{"version":"0.7.0","updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:33Z","permissions":[{"name":"manage_commands","id":"65777301-e47a-46ff-8cf2-64cbfaefcc27","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_groups","id":"23759b00-8e7c-41c0-aa7a-248cc523d56b","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_permissions","id":"b84c4383-4a55-48e8-859c-a21aa683ddff","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_relays","id":"cd3b70ff-4961-4f62-b943-3eb1af7e74b6","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_roles","id":"2d55f6cf-8fa5-4492-8dea-3b66ff388815","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_triggers","id":"2c0c02fd-b01a-4f06-9eac-5f500c33372d","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"manage_users","id":"89d60e9f-aa32-4501-be55-fa161bf59106","bundle":"operable"}],"name":"operable","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:33Z","id":"44943ea6-d9ac-43ae-bebd-49f27ea47380","enabled":true,"commands":[{"name":"alias","id":"b08fce49-6730-4db3-9a70-dc0dcabf6714","documentation":"Manages aliases

USAGE
  alias <subcommand>


SUBCOMMANDS
  new <alias-name> <alias-definition>             creates a new alias visible to the creating user.
  mv <alias-name> <site | user>:[new-alias-name]  moves aliases between user and site visibility. Optionally renames aliases.
  rm <alias-name>                                 Removes aliases
  ls [pattern]                                    Returns the list of aliases optionally filtered by pattern. Pattern support basic wildcards with '*'.


EXAMPLES
  alias new my-awesome-alias "echo "My Awesome Alias""
  > user:my-awesome-alias has been created

  alias mv my-awesome-alias site:awesome-alias
  > Moved user:my-awesome-alias to site:awesome-alias

  alias rm awesome-alias
  > Removed site:awesome-alias

  alias ls
  > Name: 'my-awesome-alias'
    Visibility: 'user'
    Pipeline: 'echo my-awesome-alias'

    Name: 'my-other-awesome-alias'
    Visibility: 'site'
    Pipeline: 'echo my-other-awesome-alias'
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"bundle","id":"d6ecd949-26d4-4066-a1be-4bbdaa584a78","documentation":"Manipulate and interrogate command bundle status.

A bundle may be either `enabled` or `disabled`. If a bundle is
enabled, chat invocations of commands contained within the bundle
will be executed. If the bundle is disabled, on the other hand, no
such commands will be run.

Bundles may be enabled or disabled independently of whether or not
any Relays are currently _running_ the bundles. The status of a
bundle is managed centrally; when a Relay serving the bundle comes
online, the status of the bundle is respected. Thus a bundle may be
enabled, but not running on any Relays, just as it can be disabled,
but running on _every_ Relay.

This can be used to either quickly disable a bundle, or as the first
step in deleting a bundle from the bot.

Note that the `operable` bundle is a protected bundle;
this bundle is always enabled and is in fact embedded in the bot
itself. Core pieces of bot functionality would not work (including
this very command itself!) if this bundle were ever disabled (though
many functions would remain available via the REST API). As a
result, calling either of the mutator subcommands `enable` or
`disable` (see below) on the `operable` bundle is an
error.

USAGE
  bundle <subcommand>


SUBCOMMANDS
  status

          bundle status <bundle_name>

     Shows the current status of the bundle, whether `enabled` or
     `disabled`. Additionally shows which Relays (if any) are running
     the code for the bundle.

     The `enable` and `disable` subcommands (see below) also return
     this information.

     Can be called on any bundle, including `operable`.

  enable

          bundle enable <bundle_name>

    Enabling a bundle allows chat commands to be routed to it. Running
    this subcommand has no effect if a bundle is already enabled.

    Cannot be used on the `operable` bundle.

  disable

          bundle disable <bundle_name>

     Disabling a bundle prevents commands from being routed to it. The
     bundle is not uninstalled, and all custom rules remain
     intact. The bundle still exists, but commands in it will not be
     executed.

     A disabled bundle can be re-enabled using this the `enable`
     sub-command; see above.

     Running this subcommand has no effect if a bundle is already
     disabled.

     Cannot be used on the `operable` bundle.

","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"echo","id":"6fc07745-942e-4238-ae88-ebdabc768c6f","documentation":"Repeats whatever it is passed.

USAGE
  echo [ARGS ...]

EXAMPLE
  echo this is nifty
  > this if nifty
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"filter","id":"92077783-7353-4566-9de9-605efbe4e460","documentation":"Filters a collection where the `path` equals the `matches`.
The `path` option is the key that you would like to focus on;
The `matches` option is the value that you are searching for.

USAGE
  filter [OPTIONS]

OPTIONS
  -m, --matches    The value to search for
  -p, --path       The key to focus on

EXAMPLES
  rules --list --for-command="permissions" | filter --path="rule" --matches="/manage_users/"
  > { "id": "91edb472-04cf-4bca-ba05-e51b63f26758",
      "rule": "operable:manage_users",
      "command": "operable:permissions" }

  seed '[{"foo":{"bar.qux":{"baz":"stuff"}}}, {"foo": {"bar":{"baz":"me"}}}]' | filter --path="foo.bar.baz""
  > [ {"foo": {"bar.qux": {"baz": "stuff"} } }, {"foo": {"bar": {"baz": "me"} } } ]

  seed '[{"foo":{"bar.qux":{"baz":"stuff"}}}, {"foo": {"bar":{"baz":"me"}}}]' | filter --path="foo.\"bar.qux\".baz""
  > { "foo": {"bar.qux": {"baz": "stuff"} } }
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"greet","id":"460007b2-7f64-4446-86ef-df0673a056ac","documentation":"Introduce the bot to new coworkers!

## Example

    @bot operable:greet @new_hire
    > Hello @new_hire
    > I'm Cog! I can do lots of things ...

","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"group","id":"b1c208ef-ea60-434b-b59d-d4f4da824644","documentation":"Manage user groups

USAGE
  group [FLAGS] <SUBCOMMAND>

SUBCOMMANDS
  list      List user groups (Default)
  info      Get info about a specific user group
  create    Creates a new user group
  delete    Deletes a user group
  member    Manage members of user groups
  role      Manage roles associated with user groups

FLAGS
  -h, --help    Display this usage info
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"help","id":"4a3af9d0-14a1-49f9-9e9e-d1dd1abbdf57","documentation":"Prints help documentation for all commands.

USAGE
  help [FLAGS] <command>

ARGS
  command  prints long form documentation

FLAGS
  -d, --disabled  Lists all disabled commands

EXAMPLES
  help
  > operable:alias
    operable:bundle
    operable:echo
    operable:filter
    operable:group
    operable:help
    operable:max
    operable:min
    operable:permissions
    operable:raw
    operable:relay
    operable:relay-group
    operable:role
    operable:rules
    operable:seed
    operable:sleep
    operable:sort
    operable:sum
    operable:table
    operable:unique
    operable:wc
    operable:which
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"max","id":"55d52871-d562-4bf9-aad1-d2249ac85c39","documentation":"Finds the maximum value in the input list.

USAGE
  max [path]

ARGS
  path  JSON path used in determining the maximum

EXAMPLES
  seed '[{"a": 2}, {"a": -1}, {"a": 3}]' | max
  > {"a": 3}

  seed '[{"a": 2}, {"a": -1}, {"a": 3}]' | max a
  > {"a": 3}

  seed '[{"a": {"b": 2}}, {"a": {"b": -1}}, {"a": {"b": 3}}]' | max a.b
  > {"a": {"b": 3}}
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"min","id":"5332d772-2e9b-4819-9c9b-ad51a66cd684","documentation":"Finds the minimum value in the input list.

USAGE
  min [path]

ARGS
  path  JSON path used in determining the minimum

EXAMPLES
  seed '[{"a": 2}, {"a": -1}, {"a": 3}]' | min
  > {"a": -1}

  seed '[{"a": 2}, {"a": -1}, {"a": 3}]' | min a
  > {"a": -1}

  seed '[{"a": {"b": 2}}, {"a": {"b": -1}}, {"a": {"b": 3}}]' | min a.b
  > {"a": {"b": -1}}
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"permissions","id":"f8d71a78-4f8f-45bd-a184-2a5fbb448b3f","documentation":"Manipulate authorization permissions.

* Create permissions in the `site` namespace
* Delete permissions in the `site` namespace
* List all permissions in the system
* Grant and revoke permissions from roles.

USAGE
  permissions --list
  permissions --create --permission=site:<name>
  permissions --delete --permission=site:<name>
  permissions --grant --permission=<namespace>:<permission> --role=<name>"
  permissions --revoke --permission=<namespace>:<permission> --role=<name>"

EXAMPLES
  permissions --list
  > The following permissions exist:

    * operable:manage_commands
    * operable:manage_groups
    * operable:manage_permissions
    * operable:manage_relays
    * operable:manage_roles
    * operable:manage_triggers
    * operable:manage_users


  permissions --create --permission=site:admin
  > Created permission 'site:admin'

  permissions --delete --permission=site:admin
  > Deleted permission 'site:admin'

  permissions --grant --role=dev --permission=site:write
  > Granted permission 'site:write' to role 'dev'

  permissions --revoke --role=dev --permission=site:write
  > Revoked permission 'site:write' from role 'dev'

","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"raw","id":"eed1ef01-8488-4a59-8518-38a7fcf74451","documentation":"Show the raw output of a command, exclusive of any templating. Useful as a
debugging tool for command authors.

USAGE
  raw

EXAMPLE
  echo foo | raw
  > {
      "body": [
        "foo"
      ]
    }

","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"relay","id":"396edd4d-65de-41d6-be85-ca6e833b949d","documentation":"Manages relays

USAGE
  relay <subcommand>

SUBCOMMANDS
  list      Lists relays and their status
  update    Update the name or description of a relay
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"relay-group","id":"f9c1b997-30c6-41f2-83a7-c75a862ea392","documentation":"Manages relay groups

USAGE
  relay-group <SUBCOMMAND>

FLAGS
  -h, --help      Display this usage info

SUBCOMMANDS
  info      Get info about one or more relay groups
  create    Creates a relay group
  rename    Renames a relay group
  delete    Deletes a relay group
  member    Managers relay and bundle assignments
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"role","id":"091d750d-39b3-4862-8ead-0531bf0158e3","documentation":"This command allows the user to manage roles.

USAGE
  role --create <rolename>
  role --drop <rolename>
  role --grant --group=<groupname> <rolename>
  role --revoke --group=<groupname> <rolename>
  role --list

EXAMPLE
  role --create deployment
  > The role 'deployment' has been created.

  role --grant --group=ops deployment
  > Granted role 'deployment' to group 'ops'

  role --revoke --group=ops deployment
  > Revoked role 'deployment' from group 'ops'

  role --drop deployment
  > The role 'deployment' has been deleted.

  role --list
  > The following are the available roles:
    * admin
    * cog-admin
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"rule","id":"48a6acca-c523-4f48-8baa-ebfbc16e202b","documentation":"Manages rules for commands.

USAGE
  rule [subcommand]

FLAGS
  -h, --help  Display this usage info

SUBCOMMANDS
  list    List all rules (default)
  create  Add a rule
  drop    Drop a rule
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"seed","id":"1d70a58d-0d95-4a64-a583-7fc5de89eba6","documentation":"Seed a pipeline with arbitrary data.

Accepts a single string argument, which must be valid JSON for
either a map or a list of maps.

Though some values may be able to be typed without enclosing quotes,
it is highly recommended to single-quote your entire string.

Best used for debugging and experimentation.

USAGE
  seed [ARGS]

EXAMPLE
  seed '{"thing":"stuff"}' | echo $thing
  > stuff

  seed '[{"thing":"stuff"},{"thing":"more stuff"}]' | echo $thing
  > stuff
  > more stuff

","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"sleep","id":"7191163a-13a3-4334-bca1-0c1ba58fcb96","documentation":"Sleeps for the provided number of seconds and emits the exact
input passed in.

USAGE
  sleep <duration>

EXAMPLES
  sleep 2400 | echo "Lasagna is done cooking!" > me
  > Lasagna is done cooking!
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"sort","id":"9be3ad55-909e-4d38-bb8a-f116f35ae053","documentation":"Sorts the given list of input in ascending order by default.

USAGE
  sort [flags] [fields...]

  Fields are used to pick which values to sort by. If two keys have the same
  value the values of the next key are compared and so on. If no fields are
  provided, items are intellegently sorted based on their contents.

FLAGS
  -a, --asc   sort in ascending order
  -d, --desc  sort in descending order

EXAMPLES
  seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 2}]' | sort
  > [{"a": 1}, {"a": 2}, {"a": 3}]

  seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 2}]' | sort --desc
  > [{"a": 3}, {"a": 2}, {"a": 1}]

  seed '[{"a": 3, "b": 4}, {"a": 1, "b": 4}, {"a": 2, "b": 6}]' | sort b a
  > [{"a": 1, "b": 4}, {"a: 3, "b": 4}, {"a": 2, "b": 6}]
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"sum","id":"149ae160-4a9a-47c2-b6fd-9db2552c99f4","documentation":"This command allows the user to sum together a list of numbers

USAGE
  sum [ARGS ...]

EXAMPLES
  sum 2 2
  > 4

  sum 2 "-9"
  > -7

  sum 2 24 57 3.7 226.78
  > 313.48
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"table","id":"cc1becf8-1512-479c-bae1-060879579217","documentation":"Converts the given list into a table of columns with headers.

USAGE
  table [columns...]

  Columns specify the keys in the json to include in the table;
  these column names are also used as headers. If no columns are
  provided, the columns will be made up of all existing keys.

EXAMPLES
  seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table
  > pizza     price
    cheese    $10
    peperoni  $12

  seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table pizza
  > pizza
    cheese
    peperoni

  seed '[{"pizza": "cheese", "price": "$10"}, {"pizza": "peperoni", "price": "$12"}]' | table price pizza
  > price  pizza
    $10    cheese
    $12    peperoni
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"thorn","id":"ca4748b3-ceb8-45b4-851f-bc5633fb7ffe","documentation":"This command replaces `Th` following a word boundary with Ã¾

## Example

    @bot operable:thorn foo-Thbar-Thbaz
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"unique","id":"c6856f9f-d827-4754-8650-a60a306aad41","documentation":"Removes all duplicate values from the given input.

USAGE
  unique

EXAMPLES
  seed '[{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}, {"a": 1}]' | unique
  > [{"a": 1}, {"a": 3}]
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"wc","id":"105186c8-43be-41c0-b13f-8bf7e534b3d8","documentation":"This command allows the user to count the number of words or lines in the input string.

USAGE
  wc [--words | --lines]  <input string>

EXAMPLE
  wc --words "Hey, what will we do today?"
  > 6

  wc --lines "From time to time
    The clouds give rest
    To the moon-beholders."
  > 3
","bundle":"operable"},{"name":"which","id":"1a99cea7-85aa-4fc6-b334-80625aa414b0","documentation":"Determine whether a given input is a command or an alias. Returns the type of
input and it's bundle or visibility. In the case of aliases it also returns
the aliased command string. This command is only useful non fully qualified
commands or aliases. Fully qualified commands or aliases will return no match.

Note: If a command is shadowed, it has an alias with the same name, the alias
will be returned.

USAGE
  which [alias]

EXAMPLE
  which my-awesome-alias
  > alias - user:my-awesome-alias -> "echo my awesome alias"

  which an-awesome-command
  > command - operable:an-awesome-command

  which not-anything
  > No matching commands or aliases.
","bundle":"operable"}],"bundle_id":"57f815c5-c986-4b93-8435-9b5b8056ddcb"}},{"versions":[{"version":"0.0.0","id":"26304739-44b2-49ce-9d96-43fecf3214e7"}],"updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:34Z","relay_groups":[],"name":"site","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:34Z","id":"296410fd-47c3-4faf-91de-9e38dcea34ca","enabled_version":null},{"versions":[{"version":"0.0.1","id":"729c8f38-fe2e-4655-b43c-c364a0b22dbe"}],"updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:51Z","relay_groups":[],"name":"enablebundle","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:51Z","id":"39846a3f-d6cd-463c-8030-ead1abff59ee","enabled_version":{"version":"0.0.1","updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:51Z","permissions":[],"name":"enablebundle","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:51Z","id":"729c8f38-fe2e-4655-b43c-c364a0b22dbe","enabled":true,"commands":[{"name":"bar","id":"25ca4a30-490b-483f-8fb6-1053c7648354","documentation":null,"bundle":"enablebundle"}],"bundle_id":"39846a3f-d6cd-463c-8030-ead1abff59ee"}},{"versions":[{"version":"0.0.1","id":"471c26c4-965c-4071-8233-6f548b2d89f1"}],"updated_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:52Z","relay_groups":[],"name":"testfoo","inserted_at":"2016-05-27T16:26:52Z","id":"d9705895-e188-42a8-b524-3a6ae7b35d0f","enabled_version":null}]}
